definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: There lies a vast extension of golden crops before us.
sentences.chinese: 一望无际的金灿灿的农作物展现在我们的眼前。

sentences.english: In autumn, the golden wheat filed was waving.
sentences.chinese: 秋天里啰，那金灿灿的麦田。

sentences.english: Bink looked at the girl beside him as she stepped through a slanting sunbeam.
sentences.chinese: 宾克看着身旁的女孩走在金灿灿的阳光下。

sentences.english: That afternoon, in the golden light of dusk, Daniel let go.
sentences.chinese: 那天下午，在金灿灿的黄昏日光中，丹尼尔落下去了。

sentences.english: The ring of Can that the hand is before ten to all dress gold Can.
sentences.chinese: 手上十指都戴着金灿灿的戒子。

sentences.english: Plant sincerity into life, and there will be golden life overgrowing on the branches.
sentences.chinese: 将真诚植入生活，金灿灿的日子就会长满枝头。

sentences.english: And often is his gold complexion dimm'd.
sentences.chinese: 金灿灿的外表却常常暗淡无光。

sentences.english: Clenched grip in the green Mo, glaring into the golden Chunhua.
sentences.chinese: 攥握在青青陌上，眩目成金灿灿的春花。

sentences.english: Naughty finally came to the center of the island, where there is a golden mountain.
sentences.chinese: 狗蛋总算来到了岛中心，那里有一座金灿灿的大山。

sentences.english: The golden leaves were like some yellow butterflys fly down slowly.
sentences.chinese: 金灿灿的落叶像一群黄澄澄的蝴蝶，慢慢地飞下来。
